section.para:
To enable a debugging log, nginx needs to be configured to support debugging during the build:
./configure --with-debug ...
Then the debug level should be set with the directive:
error_log /path/to/log debug;
The nginx binary version for Windows is always built with the debugging log support, so only setting the debug level will suffice.

section.name: Debugging log for selected clients
Logging to a cyclic memory buffer
section.para:
The debugging log can be written to a cyclic memory buffer:
error_log memory:32m debug;
Logging to the memory buffer on the debug level does not have significant impact on performance even under high load. In this case, the log can be extracted using a gdb script like the following one:
set $log = ngx_cycle->log
while $log->writer != ngx_log_memory_writer set $log = $log->next end
set $buf = (ngx_log_memory_buf_t *) $log->wdata dump binary memory debug_log.txt $buf->start $buf->end
